info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Broome, southeastern Tioga, northwestern Susquehanna and northeastern Bradford Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Windham, or 9 miles south of Owego, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Montrose, Orwell, Windham, Nichols, Rome, Le Raysville, Little Meadows, Friendsville and Warren Center. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 near 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central New York...and northeastern Pennsylvania.
